alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 7:15PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is possible in this location. * WHERE...LOS PINOS RIVER at Ortiz. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, flood waters will begin to inundate agricultural lands near the gage. Minor flooding along portions of Los Pinos Access Road will be possible. Low water crossings will become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.7 feet on 05/15/1944. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
